intro: Struthanthus flexicaulis, commonly known as the curlleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, curling leaves and showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Struthanthus flexicaulis is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
